qas.question: What did Dominic greatly struggle with?

What did Dominic refuse to do?
What did Dominic not struggle with?

context: Dominic's search for <b5_0>a close <a0_0>relationship with God<b5_0/><a0_0/> was determined and unceasing. He rarely spoke, so little of his interior life is known. What is known about it comes from accounts written by people near to him. <a1_0><b6_0>St. Cecilia<b6_0/><a1_0/> remembered him as cheerful, charitable and full of unceasing vigor. From a number of accounts, <a2_0><b7_0>sing<a2_0/>ing<b7_0/> was apparently one of Dominic's great delights. <b9_0>Dominic<b9_0/> practiced self-scourging and would mortify himself as he prayed alone in the chapel at night for <b8_0>'<a3_0>poor sinners<b8_0/><a3_0/>.' He owned a single habit, refused to <a4_0>carry money<a4_0/>, and would allow no one to serve him.
